summary: This is an email chain from October 26, 2020, between law enforcement personnel discussing the need for photos of hard drives (specifically Seagate path 100 drives) as part of an investigation, likely related to the Epstein case. The emails reference a pending warrant submission to a judge and coordination between NYPD and FBI members of a Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking Task Force.

persons.name: Detective
persons.role: NYPD / FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force member
persons.context: Appears as the sender/recipient in the email chain, coordinating about obtaining photos of hard drives and needing approval to send a warrant to a judge.

persons.name: NY CART Coordinator Senior Forensic Examiner
persons.context: Correspondent in the email chain who states they did not take photos of certain hard drives (1Bs) but took others, and offers to call to discuss.

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.role: FBI Special Agent, New York Field Office, Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking
persons.context: Mentioned in the signature block as the sender of one of the emails, involved in the investigation and warrant process.

connections.person2: NY CART Coordinator Senior Forensic Examiner
connections.description: Communicating via email to coordinate forensic examination tasks, specifically obtaining photos of hard drives for an investigation.
Both are part of law enforcement efforts (NYPD/FBI task force and FBI field office) working on a child exploitation/human trafficking case, coordinating on a warrant.

events.title: Email coordination about hard drive photos and warrant
events.description: Law enforcement personnel exchange emails discussing the need for photos of specific hard drives (Seagate path 100) and the urgency to get approval to send a warrant to a judge by the end of the day.
personsInvolved: NY CART Coordinator Senior Forensic Examiner

keyFacts: The document is an email chain dated October 26, 2020, involving members of an NYPD/FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force.
The correspondence focuses on obtaining photos of hard drives, specifically referencing '9 Seagate path 100 hard drives' and other drives (1BNs 29,30,32).
There is urgency expressed to 'square away' the matter by the end of the day because a warrant needs to be sent to a judge for approval.
The emails are marked as 'SUBJECT TO PROTECTIVE ORDER' referencing specific paragraphs, indicating sensitive or restricted information related to an ongoing investigation.
